name: PapersGPT
description: A Zotero plugin for improved papers reading and research with ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, DeepSeek, Phi 4, Llama 3.2, Gemma and Mistral.

content.overview: PapersGPT is a specialized Zotero plugin designed to enhance academic research and paper reading through AI integration. It works directly within the Zotero interface, allowing researchers to interact with their PDFs using various language models including ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, DeepSeek, Phi 4, Llama 3.2, Gemma, and Mistral. The plugin enables users to ask questions about papers, extract insights, and analyze complex research content, serving as a powerful research assistant for scholars and academics.

faqs.question: How do I install PapersGPT?
faqs.answer: Download the papersgpt.xpi plugin file, open Zotero, go to Tools > Add-ons, click the gear icon, select 'Install Add-on From File', and open the downloaded plugin file.

faqs.question: How do I start using PapersGPT?
faqs.answer: After installation, open Zotero and press the keys to start the plugin (Command+Enter on MacOS, Ctrl+Enter on Windows). Open any PDF and start asking questions.

faqs.question: Which AI models are available?
faqs.answer: PapersGPT supports multiple models including DeepSeek-R1, DeepSeek-V3, various Gemini models, Phi-4, Llama3.2, QwQ-32B-Preview, Marco-o1, Gemma2, Mistral, ChatGPT-4o, and Claude models.

faqs.question: Is my data private when using PapersGPT?
faqs.answer: Yes, especially when using local models. For Mac users, models are downloaded, installed, and run locally, ensuring your data doesn't leave your machine. The RAG modules of embeddings, vector database, and rerank are all built and run locally.
